sentence.Network_en: Education, quite rightly, is currently at the forefront of the political agenda.
sentence.Network_cn: 目前教育被排在政治议程的首位，这样做非常恰当。

sentence.Network_en: His team are at the forefront of scientific research into vaccines.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的小组处于疫苗科研的最前沿.

encyclopedia.content: 虽然Forefront Client Security (FCS)的推出受到了多方关注，但是它只是微软的Forefront产品线中的一个部分。由于FCS被设计用来为Windows系统（不论版本，包括 Windows桌面和服务器操作系统）提供保护，它也被认为是Forefront家族的旗舰产品。而Forefront家族的另一个产品线则包含了 Antigen反病毒产品和反恶意软件产品，用来为服务器应用提供保护。

entry.tran: 显著地位;重要位置;最前沿
entry.def: If you are at the forefront of a campaign or other activity, you have a leading and influential position in it.

example.ex: They have been at the forefront of the campaign for political change.
example.tran: 他们一直处于政治变革运动的风口浪尖上。

entry.def: If something is at the forefront of people's minds or attention, they think about it a lot because it is particularly important to them.

example.ex: The pension issue was not at the forefront of his mind in the spring of 1985.
example.tran: 在 1985 年春，养老金问题并非他关注的重点。

means.word_mean: 1. the part in the front or nearest the viewer;

sentences.sentence: "he was at the head of the column"

means.word_mean: 2. the position of greatest advancement; the leading position in any movement or field

sentences.en: The new factory could put the town back at the forefront of steelmaking.

means.word_mean: 位于最前列；成为领导力量

sentences.en: The new product took the company to the forefront of the computer software market.
sentences.cn: 新产品使得该公司在计算机软件市场处于领先地位。

sentences.en: The court case was constantly in the forefront of my mind.
sentences.cn: 这宗诉讼案一直压在我心头。
